results.title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
results.creator_credit: Christina Pozzan, Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Pozzan, Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham and Film Australia

results.title: K.C.I.: beyond the three r's
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Silva Basmajian, Arthur Ham and Scott Barrie
results.brief_description: Kitchener Waterloo Collegiate and Vocational School embodies some of the best features of public secondary education today. The school encourages students to learn beyond the classroom through innovative programs like Cooperative Education or Community Involvement, and welcomes adults into the school to complete their education or upgrade their skills. Through candid views of school activities, classroom discussions, and interviews with staff and students, the film takes its audience through a busy day at a large urban high school. It approaches many of the questions in the current debate on education.

results.title: Justin de Marseille
results.brief_description:
Justin is the boss of a drug trafficking gang who enjoys a great popularity for also offering protection to the poor. But Esposito, his old time rival, has sworn to eliminate him.

Credits: Director, Maurice Tourneur ; writer, Carlo Rim ; photography, Georges Benoit, Rene Colas ; music, Vincent Scotto, Jacques Ibert.
Cast: Berval, Ghislaine Bru, Pierre Larquey, Alexandre Rignault, Line Noro.

results.title: Justice: a kindness cup. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project and Michael Vance
results.brief_description: Part 1 (28min): Dr. Jonathan Sher, visiting American educationalist, Dr Don Edgar and Peter Couchman explore and develop issues from “A Kindness Cup.” These include whether justice or revenge is sought, what is achieved, the connection between power and justice and between disdvantage and justice. Part 2 (28min) continues the discussion and cites specific examples to illustrate the “nature of justice”, punishment, miscarriage of justice and social justice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project and Michael Vance

results.title: Justice, liberty and law: an introduction
results.brief_description: The American Bill of Rights provides a focal point for discussion of the ideal of justice. What is right and fair? Rights of the individual are raised for discussion. Individual rights to protest and the need to keep law and order are presented as conflicting interests. A number of people who hold opposing views are interviewed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Just who's prejudiced? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A look at the claim that some migrant Australians will not associate with Anglo-Saxon Australians because they lack ‘culture’. Is there such a thing as an ‘Ocker Aussie?’
